messages.subject: Re: slow today
messages.msgSnippet: ... need to ... it explodes ... The joy of no-mail setting!  No full inboxes, and I can read them at my leisure. I ve been busy getting my newsletter ready
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Lesa McMahon-Lowe"
<lesajm@...> wrote:
>
> lol... you know... I have over 2000 messages in my inbox that I
need to
> purge... lol... i think i'll take the time now to do that before
it explodes
> again. :)
>
> Lesa

The joy of "no-mail" setting! No full inboxes, and I can read them
at my leisure. I've been busy getting my newsletter ready for
mailing -- one quick question for the previous owner before I do,
and I might even get it to the post office today -- a day early!
I'm thrilled to be done -- and starting to wonder how I can improve
for next time. (The first issue has to be the hardest, right?
Right??)

Linda

messages.subject: Re: slow today
messages.msgSnippet: I was away from home nearly all day!  I had errands this morning and since my DH works from home on Mondays I was able to just get started this morning without
messages.messageBody:
I was away from home nearly all day! I had errands this morning and
since my DH works from home on Mondays I was able to just get
started this morning without waiting for the children to wake up.
When I got home, my daughter and I decided to go to the Scholastic
Book Warehouse sale which consumed the next 4 hours of our day (one
hour drive time each way, 2 hours of browsing). We found some fun
stuff. The ultimate winner is a small tube of water called the FS
Twister Tube. You shake it and it looks like a tornado. My son
Jeffrey has been very into tornadoes lately, so he was thrilled with
this find. Then when I got home, I got a phone call from my
attorney who needed more paperwork. I have a custody issue going on
with my oldest child. She is moving in with me and her dad is
freaking out. I sure wish there was an easy way to handle this!
He's afraid I might homeschool her. Ooohh... *lol* I told him I
wasn't going to discuss it with him.

We played Nintendo while dinner cooked and then I read a book for a
while. The kids are currently in the hallway throwing balls to each
other. I think I'm turning the Nintendo back on. :)

Beth M.

From: kbcdlovejo@...
Date: 05/22/06 18:08:32
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] slow today

Be careful what you wish for! <G>

Historically, when one of these lists is quiet and someone mentions it,
the list explodes; and it isn't long before your mailbox is TOO full!


~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://liveandlearnconference.org

"The hardest problem for the brain is not learning, but forgetting. No
matter how hard we try, we can't deliberately forget something we have
learned, and that is catastrophic if we learn that we can't learn."
~Frank Smith

messages.subject: Re: slow today
messages.msgSnippet: We re here! My youngest, Jacqueline went camping with her Brownie troop this past weekend and had a great time. Cimion went to his yu-gi-oh duel league over
messages.messageBody:
We're here!

My youngest, Jacqueline went camping with her Brownie troop this
past weekend and had a great time. Cimion went to his yu-gi-oh duel
league over the weekend and traded for osme cards he's been wanting.
Shawna is having a really hard time of things right now. This is a
very emotional time (the two weeks leading up to her birthday) of
the year for her. When my children were removed from their abusive
home, it was just two days before her 4th birthday and she carries
around that pain amd anger with her. I posted a recipe for slime on
my blog along with some links we've been visiting. I'm getting over
pnemonia...this is the best I've felt in two weeks! I just bought
one last of the expansion packs for The Sims and have been playing
non-stop! LOL!!
That's it for us!

~ Joanne ~
Mom to Jacqueline (7), Shawna (10) & Cimion (13)
Adopted into our hearts October 30, 2003
http://anunschoolinglife.blogspot.com/
http://foreverparents.com
